meanings.sent1: She wyled him into believing her story.
meanings.sent2: He wyled his friend into thinking he had won the game.
meanings.sent3: The magician wyled the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The con artist wyled unsuspecting victims out of their money.
meanings.sent5: The fox wyled the rabbit into a trap with promises of safety.

meanings.sent1: The scammer wyled innocent people out of their savings.
meanings.sent2: She wyled her way out of trouble by telling a convincing lie.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child wyled his siblings into playing a prank on their parents.
meanings.sent4: The spy wyled valuable information from the enemy.
meanings.sent5: The clever cat wyled the birds with its playful antics.

meanings.sent1: The wyled promises of the salesman left customers disappointed.
meanings.sent2: Her wyled smile hid her true intentions.
meanings.sent3: The wyled appearance of the product did not match its actual quality.
meanings.sent4: The wyled advertisement exaggerated the benefits of the product.
meanings.sent5: The wyled appearance of the house masked its structural issues.
